question: I'm old. And all I have left is the will to remember... ...and the fear I'll forget... I killed innocent men. I betrayed sacred oaths. I reaped profit from horror. answer: -the what?

question: Meet me down the street from his place. You got bolt cutters?
answer: I'll bring `em.

question: Thirty minutes.
answer: Who's car is that?

question: Long story.
answer: Junior looked real skeezed this morning. Like he was on a dope jag.

question: Yeah?
answer: Sweated up like a stuck pig. And be careful. He was fucking around with his front door before he left. I don't know what he was doing.

question: Two honks if he shows. Then meet me in the alley, back of his place.
answer: What about this Bledsoe broad? Milteer has called me twice.

question: One thing at a time pal. Junior the Insane Junior stealing evidence from the Magdalena crime scene. Junior the Climber, trading me up to Noonan. Thinks bootlicking will buy him a Bureau gig.
answer: Asshole!

question: Call it. Keep going and give up Wilhite's car and the corpse inside, or lay back and deal with Noonan's Buzzcuts. Civil servants can't afford manicures?
answer: Breaking and entering, theft, and willful destruction of private property...and I'll add attempted murder to the current first degree murder charge I'm about to file against you.

question: Proof. If you had it, you wouldn't be fucking around with shitty shakedown routine -- you'd file. Coercion equals confession. So let's see you pound it out of me.
answer: Where are the files you stole from Sergeant Richard Stemmons.

question: Junior. Your secret weapon right? I mean, I know J. Edgar is a slanted fuck, but traditionally `vicious fags' don't make the best major case witnesses. I'm worried those burning dildos may have damaged his credibility.
answer: Oh I don't need his testimony Klein. I'll just force yours.

question: Not if you had the next hundred years.
answer: Sanderline Johnson, your links to Sam Giancana to Mickey Cohen, extortion, bribes, murder-for-hire. I'll put you in every pair of cross- hairs I can find. I'll torch everything you've ever touched. You have no idea how deep I run Klein. And how far I'm willing to go to fuck you-

question: -everyone knows I'm a piece-a-shit. What are you proving? Bradley's the guy flanking you right now. The guy who's vulnerable right now.
answer: You're all angles and graft Klein. Why trust a God damn word that comes out of your-

question: -you done anything with the Magdalena case?
answer: Prelims

question: -Dealing drugs for 20 years! Arrested once. Hall a' fame career! You photographed the head of Narco in-front of his house...
answer: AND?

question: Jesus Christ, you need cue cards? Come after me
answer: I don't believe you'd turn. Treacherous yes, traitorous no. Tell me where Stemmons' files are.

question: I'll bring them to you.
answer: You're not leaving here Klein.

question: Then like I said
answer: I'll take it.

question: I give you the body of Dan Wilhite, head of LAPD's Narcotics Division. Proof of a 20-year criminal collusion between his department and Hector Magdalena and my testimony to link the dots. Then I leave LA for good.
answer: What happened to Wilhite?

question: Suicide.
answer: Like Sanderline Johnson? Get me Stemmons files and Wilhite's body by noon tomorrow.

question: No more tails. I don't want anyone else incriminated.
answer: Agreed.

question: I get a copy of that?
answer: After a judge signs it. Now Leave. We wait for him to deliver, then we arrest him. You never saw that agreement. No. Let him get comfortable...let him believe me.

question: Running out of room, time, both. Trapped between Bradley and Noonan.
answer: I know what Feds look like -- those were Feds with Junior...

question: Yeah and they made me leaving the scene. Had to barter out.
answer: Barter what?

question: My Testimony. I signed a Federal Witness Agreement.
answer: You what?

question: It's bullshit. Noonan's got no intention of honoring it. They want Stemmons files though. I think Junior's been working angles for awhile, doing his own investigations.
answer: What did you do to his place? Nice quiet neighborhood one minute, Nagasaki the next.

question: He had a hand grenade tied to that. How much longer do you need?
answer: Few more hours. Maybe. Junior didn't skimp on this thing. I gotta bore right through the face plate. You got some time now, why don't you get Milteer off my back and go work that Bledsoe broad.

question: You read my mind. ...tell me if I'm being too rough. Tell me anything. Tell me everything.
answer: Where would I start?

question: Why here?
answer: Why L.A.? Why is anybody here? Want the rest of the world to know who they are.

question: You?
answer: No...I don't think so. I just love it. I grew up in Seattle. My aunt, every week, she'd take me to the movies.

question: -your ticket to immortality?
answer: Hughes told me he could get me in for this screen test two years ago. Movie with Gregory Peck at Universal. He thought he was humoring me...until I got it. They offered me the role...there in the room. So Howard, who I'm sure never thought in a million years I'd land that part, makes some phone calls and just like that they don't want me anymore. Nobody calls now. I can't get in to see any studio casting people. He's ruined me in those circles.

question: And you still want it-
answer: -bad enough to put on a silly cheerleading skirt and try to make the most god-awful dialogue sound decent.

question: Surrounded by winos in werewolf suits. That's...dedication.
answer: Or desperation. Depends on the day. I'll get there though. I'll get there.

question: Dwight Gillette.
answer: He asked me to take his `niece and nephew' to their cousin in Oxnard. These beautiful, funny little kids. I dropped them off. Didn't ask any questions -- I believed Dwight. A week later I saw their pictures in the Post Office. A week after that their little bodies came in on the tide near San Pedro. I'll never shake the thought that maybe those poor kids thought I was part of it. That I knew what was going to happen to them. So I pray to God that he let them look in when I put that knife into Dwight. But I'll never ask his forgiveness for doing it... Why do they call you `Enforcer?'

question: I've killed 44 men. 33 for War. 2 for principle. 9 for profit -- mostly. Why did you sign with Hughes, knowing what he was?
answer: `For profit -- mostly.'

question: I'm not much good.
answer: Me neither.

question: The Knife ain't there. File on top of that middle pile Junior documented everything like a fucking Monk. Like here
answer: You been up all night?

question: In-case Stemmons made a house-call. He's got every goddamn address of everybody you know... And you should've told me about the Bledsoe broad.
answer: There's nothing to tell.

question: Then call Milteer about this dead Pimp Gillette. I'm no legal mind like you, but I'll bet a murder beef would violate her morals clause quick. Collect the rest of your money.
answer: I don't want it anymore.

question: Then give that five grand back.
answer: Junior stole it.

question: Your young partner called me at my home, early this morning. Heavily inebriated. Speaking inarticulately of `betrayal,' & how the LAPD was set to be `blitzed by justice.' Is this the `bind' of which we spoke earlier?
answer: Yeah.

question: And his apartment -- there was some type of disturbance? A fire?
answer: That's why I needed his address. I was trying to help him before something like this happened. The kid snapped-in-half Fritz. He's literally lost it. He say anything else to you?

question: Only that he was in possession of materials that might deeply damage Chief Bradley...and yourself.
answer: Like I said Fritz, he's flipped his lid. I don't want to go to Internal Affairs but I'm afraid Junior might've forced just that.

question: Let me try to locate the lad first Dave. Be a shame to ruin such a young career so soon.
answer: Be careful Fritz. He's dangerous. Fritz Koenig, the best inspector in the LAPD, digging. He'll find Junior and when he does he'll find Ainge...then Glenda... Where is he? Noonan's deadline lapsed ten minutes ago. An official fugitive from justice now. Bradley doing damage control, the forced relocation of the Ravine's immigrants has the press in a feeding frenzy. Reuben Ruiz forced along as the token Mexican mouthpiece.

question: Be careful Fritz. He's dangerous. Fritz Koenig, the best inspector in the LAPD, digging. He'll find Junior and when he does he'll find Ainge...then Glenda... Where is he? Noonan's deadline lapsed ten minutes ago. An official fugitive from justice now. Bradley doing damage control, the forced relocation of the Ravine's immigrants has the press in a feeding frenzy. Reuben Ruiz forced along as the token Mexican mouthpiece.
answer: -this area has long been rife with crime and venality, but with a brand new Stadium, we can make this horrible blight a bright spot and give our Los Angeles Dodgers the home they deserve. Reuben Ruiz can tell you of his travails growing up in this horrible slum and why now is the time to `Redeem The Ravine.' -Welles Noonan is an unscrupulous hack politician whose smear campaign against us will fail, for he has grievously underestimated the moral rectitude of the Los Angeles Police Department. Now if you'll excuse me, I'll leave you with Reuben Ruiz.

question: Your subpoena hasn't caught up to me yet, Chief... Hurwitz Holdings. You, Bethune, and Gallaudet bought big chunks of Chavez Ravine over the past two years through a shell company called Hurwitz Holdings. If the Dodgers move here the value of the land booms...you could sell it off for a fortune -- or hang onto it and make even more. The parking lots alone would make you all multi-millionaires. Word gets out that the three City Officials who were pushing hardest for a Stadium also stood to gain a mint -- might color public opinion. Might color it even more to know that the LAPD's Chief of Detectives was trying to purchase a huge tract of that land from the biggest dope dealer in town. Hector Magdalena owned ten and half acres of this land. You didn't give a shit about solving his disappearance. You were worried that your real estate deal was going south.
answer: How?

question: Junior Stemmons. The ex-evidence teacher. His `excellent ratings' didn't stop him from stealing the Magdalena seizure and doing his own investigation.
answer: Why would he investigate me?

question: That was stapled to the cover. Why would Noonan worry about a Turd like me now...when a high profile target like you can be taken down.
answer: Where is Stemmons?

question: No idea. If you haven't spoken to Internal Affairs today, I'm sure they've called. Junior's apartment caught fire. Deeply deviant material inside. Round him up- -and anyone he's got with him.
answer: I'll issue an A.P.B. saying Stemmons is a known deviant targeting kindergarten children.

question: Now, quid pro quo...you subpoenaed Wilhite too.
answer: How do y-

question: -don't worry `how.' Why? You're going after Narco yourself.
answer: Exposing the corrupt parts of the LAPD will redeem the whole. I'll prove that Police can police themselves-

question: -so you show-up Noonan...co-opt his crusade and condemn your own before he can...Jesus Christ can you turn lemons to lemonade.
answer: No Cop will testify against other Cops. This is why Wilhite has suddenly disappeared.

question: And how. So where do we go now Chief?
answer: There are other forces at work here...faces we need to identify. Names we need to know. A third party.

question: -that report is only useful to Noonan now.
answer: No. It ensures our mutual destruction should you choose to share the contents of that Stemmons file. Which I know you won't do until you figure out how it will best benefit you.

question: You taking her?
answer: I'm taking her.

question: What?
answer: Hughes.

question: This is almost over Pete -- I'll give Milteer the five-grand back.
answer: It's more than that.

question: I'll square it. It's my thing.
answer: That you made mine.

question: I'm sorry.
answer: Look as bad as I've ever seen you.

question: Things are as bad as they've ever been... Bradley's Third Party Theory. Everything linked Klein.
answer: MOTHERFUCKER -- you better meet me! That Cooze you threw everything away for is still cooked! I got the knife. I got Ainge-

question: How'd you get this number Junior?
answer: I got everything on you! AND I'M GONNA USE IT!

question: -you're a broom-closet Queer. Your career is over.
answer: The knife for MY file on Bradley. I know you already burned that Whore's but don't think I can't re- do investigations.

question: You snitch to Noonan, then what?
answer: Fuck Noonan. I got stronger Allies.

question: Who? The Soviets?
answer: Meet me in one hour with that file, Fern Dell Park-

question: -Where you used to snag fruits for Vice? A volunteer gig I'm guessing.
answer: Be there with Bradley's file or I scratch your scabby Bitch.

question: Hey, did the Feds dig your pad? -I see anybody near there Junior, the deals off and I gift that file to Bradley to fuck you with-
answer: -Dave?

question: Glenda?
answer: Sorry...you gave me this number...

question: Jesus...hey...
answer: Who were you talking-

question: -no, no. It's nothing. I had a phone call, just before yours.
answer: Was it him? The Cop you were telling me about?

question: I don't want you to worry. I'm handling it. But I might send my friend Pete out there.
answer: You don't think it's safe?

question: I'd just rather have someone there with you.
answer: I wish you would've woken me up this morning.

question: I'm better-looking in low light, I didn't want to blow it for myself. Stay by the phone.
answer: I miss you.

question: Where's the knife. Turn your lights off...and just come out and talk to me...Fritz. Third Party Confirmed...I fucking knew it.
answer: Not much with these sub-rosa things...

question: I thought it was Noonan tailing me.
answer: Bradley's greatest stroke was enlisting you to his side.

question: Wilhite ran Magdalena for you, not Narco.
answer: When did you know?

question: I didn't. I had a feeling. I smelled cover-up all over Hector's disappearance and Wilhite wouldn't have the muscle or the mind-set to kingpin something that big by himself...you knew about Bradley trying to buy him out?
answer: He was offering to exonerate Hector and clear his criminal record. Hector met with Wilhite and I to inform us of his decision... ...to accept Bradley's deal... ...and although the terms of that deal worked well for him. I found them less than favorable... Darktown. Chavez Ravine. Hot Spots for Human Vice. These are slums I run & profit from. If these slums suddenly become Stadiums, that profit goes elsewhere...that crime goes elsewhere.

question: Bradley...you two got greed in common. You knew about Wilhite and Lucille. That's how you were operating him.
answer: I was aware of his sexual predilections.

question: ...and someone else's...
answer: We share an eye for human frailty and we're both born blackmailers Dave. I knew young Stemmons here had a fondness for Lads, stretching back to his days at the academy.

question: Who?
answer: Fritz Koenig.

question: Where?
answer: Dead. Along with Wilhite, Junior...and Hector Magdalena.

question: Why are you here?
answer: To collect. I have the things you need to destroy Noonan's play. These same things can be used to destroy you.

question: Things like?
answer: Stemmons files...and Wilhite's body. He committed suicide after you subpoenaed him.

question: This body is in your possession?
answer: And it's what you need to burn Narco to the ground...but if those files and his body were to be given to Noonan and the Feds, with me providing the cherry-on-top testimony of a rogue cop. Well. The word `Cataclysmic' comes to mind.

question: What will this cost?
answer: A percentage of your Dodger Stadium stake in perpetuity. You buy my silence for a fourth of Hurwitz Holdings.

question: Doubtful.
answer: What'd you expect? A stick-up? Empty your safe? I'm about to disappear for good, and you're gonna fund my new life. You can't counter-punch out of this. Arrest me and I snitch the world. I'll hold that over your head for the rest of your life. Renege on our deal and it won't matter if it's tomorrow or ten years from now...I'll fry you with that file. I'm officially outta time now Chief. Call it.

question: Wilhite's body...Bury it.
answer: Shaking to see her, touch her... You go to bed drunk, or just been up all night. Seen Pete do this a dozen times and every time the same thought Don't kill me.

question: ...I'm sorry Dave...
answer: I put you here...that Powerhawk-

question: -there's a body in the trunk-
answer: -burn it.

question: Let me take you to a hospital.
answer: We'd never make it inside.

question: I'm worried.
answer: I'm through the worst of it.

question: I don't believe you. Was I worth this?
answer: Whatever the cost.

question: Just like that then?
answer: Just like that. My deadline with Noonan Cop-killings clear the way for Bradley's "Redeem The Ravine' mandate. Dodger Stadium construction moves forward. Captain Dan Wilhite and Hector Magdalena. Missing. APB's issued. Bradley's press fodder cast them as `outlaw cop and drug dealer' who most likely fled to Mexico. Narco under a full-blown, Bradley-led investigation.
